content.description:
Sit start, and hold the two gorgeous jugs low on the

South Arête

; throw your left hand out to a hold that offers a sharp crimp and a sidepull. Pick one. Adjust your feet; move your right hand up to a 45 degree crimp just under the horn at the top of the

South Arête

. Move your left hand to a beautiful, full pad crimp in the middle of the face, adjust your feet, and then throw for a perfect mono pocket with your left hand before topping out.

This route intentionally avoids the arete above the starting holds as well as the juggy ledge that runs across the top.
content.location:
Looking at Arch Boulder from the West side, start low on the right side. This will be the

South Arete

. Climb the West face of Arch Boulder to the right of the crack.

climbs.name: Why Are You Upside Down?(West Crack Footlead)

content.description: Start the crux, foot lead the crack, then grab the jug left handed, and finish normally.

An eliminate problem that avoids the luscious

North Arête

. All face holds are between the arete and crack are on. It is easier if you cut out to either earlier. Sit start on a left-facing jug with your feet pasted on. Bust up and right past large, flat holds to a final move to the juggy apex of the boulder to top out.

Sit start in hand jams, and wrestle past a sharkfin chockstone with fist jams and footwork. A 'look, Ma, no-hands' kneelock can be found here. Finish the wide pod with easy offwidthing, laybacking right or a slightly harder left layback finish.
content.location: This ascends the crack that faces Kintergarden Rock / the road.

content.description: Traverse around the boulder.  Fun heel hooks help get across the west face.

Start at the bottom left of “crack rock” wall. Consider a high left heel to gain a right hand undercling. Two finger gaston to the crack with minimal slabby footholds. DON'T TOUCH THE CRACK ROCK. Traverse under crack rock into quarter of crimps with each hand. Consider foot jams and toe hooks. Make a static move to a good ledge on the middle right side of the wall to finish. The goal is to stay low on this traverse, and stay static. Anything above halfway up is off until the finishing ledge. Do some sit ups.
content.protection: Maybe one of over the only rock, this can be done with no protection also.
content.location: Sit start on left side of “crack rock wall” traverse low, and DON'T TOUCH THE CRACK ROCK! The finishing move is from minimal crimps to a good ledge on the far right.

content.description: Do a sitting start to an undercling avoiding the flake, then move up to the topout.
Sit start on the right side of the arête. Gain the prominent ledge, and mantel it. You get bonus points if you can straddle it no handed. Then top out the slab.
The south face has huge holds for an easy ascent, OR run, jump, and grab the highest jug you can. How high can you go?
content.location: It is left of the micro-arch.

content.description: Start on a chest high undercling, and move to a left hand crimp and a right hand sidepull. From there, the crux begins with a big move to the tiny, right hand crimp. Move your feet up, and make another big, left hand, gaston type crimp move. Hold that, and you are at the easy topout.
content.location:
It is to the left of

West Crack

in between

West Crack

and

West Face Left

.

content.description:
Layback and heel hook up and right the left side of the West Face. Mantel onto the

North Slab

once at the top.
Head up or down the featured green slab. If your imagination is strong enough, pretend you're soloing the Flatirons for a second.
content.location:
Thsi is between the shrub and the

North Arête

.

content.description: Start at the SW arete. Traverse left avoiding any contact with the “Crack Rock” or holds on top of the boulder, and finish at NW arete. This has fun crimps, a mono pocket, foot jams, and heel hooks! Traverse North to South for a V4, the same holds are off.
content.location: Start at the obvious SW arete. Finish at the obvious NW arete.

content.description: Sit start, mantel the arch, and climb the east crack to the top. Small people can try to tunnel the arch mid-route for bonus points.
content.location: It is on the Arch Boulder.
